snippet.title: Subiaco unit fire started by smoking
snippet.content: A RESIDENT smoking in bed has sparked a blaze inside a Perth unit on Monday night. According to the Department of Fire and Emergency Services, the blaze inside the Subiaco unit started accidentally around 7pm. Fire crews found smoke coming from the Subiaco Road unit on arrival, with one person suffering smoke inhalation at the scene. That person was treated by paramedics and sustained only minor injuries. Firefighters were able to extinguish the blaze shortly after, with the Department of Housing called in to assess the extent of the damage to their property. DFES has estimated the damage bill at $80,000.
